nodes.title: Introduction to Data Science & Ethics
nodes.rationale: To begin a new career in data science, it's crucial to first understand what data science entails, the roles within the field, and the fundamental ethical considerations that underpin all data-related activities. This foundational module sets the stage for responsible and informed practice.
suggested_micro_topics: Code of Ethics in Data Science

nodes.title: Foundational Programming with Python
nodes.rationale: Given little prior coding experience, a strong foundation in a versatile language like Python is essential. Python is widely used in data science for data manipulation, analysis, and machine learning, making it a critical first step for practical application.
suggested_micro_topics: Python Syntax and Basic Data Types
Basic Data Structures (Lists, Tuples, Dictionaries, Sets)
Introduction to Python Libraries (NumPy for arrays, Pandas for DataFrames)

nodes.title: Essential Mathematics & Statistics for Data Science
nodes.rationale: Data science is heavily rooted in statistical and mathematical concepts. Understanding these fundamentals is vital for interpreting data, building models, and making data-driven decisions, even with little prior experience.
suggested_micro_topics: Descriptive Statistics (Mean, Median, Mode, Variance, Standard Deviation)
Probability Theory Basics (Events, Conditional Probability, Bayes' Theorem)
Inferential Statistics (Hypothesis Testing, p-values, Confidence Intervals)
Introduction to Linear Algebra (Vectors, Matrices - conceptual for ML)

nodes.title: Data Collection and Management Fundamentals
nodes.rationale: Before any analysis can occur, data must be properly collected, acquired, and managed. This module covers the initial steps of a data science project, ensuring data is reliable and organized for subsequent steps.
suggested_micro_topics: Identifying Data Sources (APIs, Databases, Web Scraping)
Data Storage Systems (Relational vs. Non-relational databases)

nodes.title: Data Wrangling and Manipulation
nodes.rationale: Real-world data is rarely clean. This module teaches the practical skills needed to clean, transform, and prepare raw data for analysis, a crucial step that often consumes a significant portion of a data scientist's time.

nodes.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) & Visualization
nodes.rationale: Once data is clean, EDA allows for initial insights and hypothesis generation. Data visualization is key to understanding patterns, communicating findings effectively, and making data accessible to others.
suggested_micro_topics: Plotting with Matplotlib and Seaborn (Histograms, Scatter Plots, Box Plots)

nodes.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
nodes.rationale: Machine learning is a core component of modern data science, enabling predictive modeling and pattern recognition. This module introduces fundamental concepts and algorithms, building upon statistical and programming foundations.
suggested_micro_topics: Model Training and Evaluation Metrics (Accuracy, Precision, Recall)

nodes.title: Real-World Projects & Portfolio Building
nodes.rationale: To transition into a data science career, practical application of learned skills through projects is paramount. This module focuses on integrating all previous knowledge into tangible projects and showcasing them to potential employers.
suggested_micro_topics: Version Control with Git and GitHub Basics
